meanings.definition: To treat someone as a celebrity or hero.
meanings.sent1: The town was lionising the local firefighter for his bravery.
meanings.sent2: The media was lionising the actor for his latest performance.
meanings.sent3: At the school talent show, the students were lionising the math teacher's magic tricks.
meanings.sent4: The community was lionising the young artist, comparing her to a rising star.
meanings.sent5: The children were lionising their favorite superhero, pretending to have superpowers like him.

meanings.definition: To give someone a lot of attention and admiration.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was lionising the student for her exceptional essay.
meanings.sent2: The fans were lionising the singer at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat was lionising the new toy, playing with it all day.
meanings.sent4: The company was lionising the employee of the month, praising her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The community was lionising the local artist, attending all her exhibitions.

meanings.definition: To make someone seem important or famous.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team was lionising the new product to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: The journalist was lionising the politician in the article.
meanings.sent3: The chef was lionising the secret ingredient, making it the highlight of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The photographer was lionising the model, capturing her in glamorous poses.
meanings.sent5: The museum was lionising the historical artifact, displaying it in a special exhibit.
